Randomized Controlled Trials

Author

Sriramkumar Sarida

1 Chatbot effect on E - Commerce Business

1.1 Load the data frame

abtest_data  <- readRDS("../../data/abtest_online.rds")
head(abtest_data)

Plotting the abtest data to check the balance

library(ggplot2)

compare_purchase <- 
  ggplot(abtest_data, aes(x = as.factor(chatbot), y = purchase, color = as.factor(chatbot))) +
  stat_summary(geom = "errorbar", 
               width = .5,
               fun.data = "mean_se", 
               fun.args = list(mult=1.96),
               show.legend = FALSE) +
  labs(x = NULL, y = "Purchase", title = "Difference in purchase")


compare_purchase_amount <- 
  ggplot(abtest_data, aes(x = as.factor(chatbot), y = purchase_amount, color = as.factor(chatbot))) +
  stat_summary(geom = "errorbar", 
               width = .5,
               fun.data = "mean_se", 
               fun.args = list(mult=1.96),
               show.legend = FALSE) +
  labs(x = NULL, y = "Purchase Amount", title = "Difference in purchase amount")

Plot for purchase

compare_purchase

Plot for purchase amount

compare_purchase_amount

1.2 Run a regression to find the effect of chatbot on sales.

lm_fit <- lm(purchase_amount ~ chatbot + previous_visit + mobile_device, data=abtest_data)
summary(lm_fit)
#> 
#> Call:
#> lm(formula = purchase_amount ~ chatbot + previous_visit + mobile_device, 
#>     data = abtest_data)
#> 
#> Residuals:
#>     Min      1Q  Median      3Q     Max 
#> -25.414 -14.428  -8.435  12.559  64.584 
#> 
#> Coefficients:
#>                   Estimate Std. Error t value Pr(>|t|)    
#> (Intercept)        15.2840     1.1227  13.614  < 2e-16 ***
#> chatbotTRUE        -6.8488     1.1792  -5.808 8.49e-09 ***
#> previous_visit      0.7792     0.2869   2.716  0.00673 ** 
#> mobile_deviceTRUE  -0.8562     1.2642  -0.677  0.49841    
#> ---
#> Signif. codes:  0 '***' 0.001 '**' 0.01 '*' 0.05 '.' 0.1 ' ' 1
#> 
#> Residual standard error: 18.6 on 996 degrees of freedom
#> Multiple R-squared:  0.04243,    Adjusted R-squared:  0.03954 
#> F-statistic: 14.71 on 3 and 996 DF,  p-value: 2.228e-09
  • The chatbot variable seems to be having a negative impact on purchase amount with an estimate of -6.8488. This implies that the chatbot presence has decreased the sales and thereby reducing the purchase amount.

1.3 Find subgroup-specific effects by including an interaction. Compute a CATE for one exemplary group. A subgroup could be for example mobile users.

lm_cate <- lm(purchase_amount ~ chatbot * mobile_device + previous_visit, data=abtest_data)
summary(lm_cate)
#> 
#> Call:
#> lm(formula = purchase_amount ~ chatbot * mobile_device + previous_visit, 
#>     data = abtest_data)
#> 
#> Residuals:
#>     Min      1Q  Median      3Q     Max 
#> -25.403 -14.450  -8.445  12.549  64.562 
#> 
#> Coefficients:
#>                               Estimate Std. Error t value Pr(>|t|)    
#> (Intercept)                   15.27384    1.19130  12.821  < 2e-16 ***
#> chatbotTRUE                   -6.82837    1.42580  -4.789 1.93e-06 ***
#> mobile_deviceTRUE             -0.82375    1.79309  -0.459  0.64605    
#> previous_visit                 0.77914    0.28711   2.714  0.00677 ** 
#> chatbotTRUE:mobile_deviceTRUE -0.06455    2.52907  -0.026  0.97964    
#> ---
#> Signif. codes:  0 '***' 0.001 '**' 0.01 '*' 0.05 '.' 0.1 ' ' 1
#> 
#> Residual standard error: 18.6 on 995 degrees of freedom
#> Multiple R-squared:  0.04243,    Adjusted R-squared:  0.03858 
#> F-statistic: 11.02 on 4 and 995 DF,  p-value: 9.485e-09

1.4 Binomial Outcome

glm_fit <- glm(purchase ~ chatbot + previous_visit + mobile_device, family=binomial, data=abtest_data)
summary(glm_fit)
#> 
#> Call:
#> glm(formula = purchase ~ chatbot + previous_visit + mobile_device, 
#>     family = binomial, data = abtest_data)
#> 
#> Coefficients:
#>                   Estimate Std. Error z value Pr(>|z|)    
#> (Intercept)       -0.22185    0.12347  -1.797  0.07237 .  
#> chatbotTRUE       -0.96894    0.13564  -7.144 9.09e-13 ***
#> previous_visit     0.10606    0.03262   3.252  0.00115 ** 
#> mobile_deviceTRUE -0.07119    0.14530  -0.490  0.62417    
#> ---
#> Signif. codes:  0 '***' 0.001 '**' 0.01 '*' 0.05 '.' 0.1 ' ' 1
#> 
#> (Dispersion parameter for binomial family taken to be 1)
#> 
#>     Null deviance: 1329.1  on 999  degrees of freedom
#> Residual deviance: 1262.2  on 996  degrees of freedom
#> AIC: 1270.2
#> 
#> Number of Fisher Scoring iterations: 4
  • The estimated values from the logistic regression might not be as straightforward as linear regression, because the coefficients represent the change in logarithmic odds of the outcome for a unit change in the predictor variable.
